title: What are some sample questions for the IELTS general module writing task 1? - Quora

response.answer_text: Hi ! In Task 1 of IELTS General training module, you're required to write a letter of at least 150 words in about 20 minutes. There are 2 types of letter: Casual letterFormal letterWhen you write a letter, you must first decide what register you will be using; in other words how casual or formal your writing will be. This depends on who you are writing to. A casual letter could be written to a friend, a relative or a classmate. Here are some casual letter samples: 1.  2.  3.  4.  Some tips to write a casual letter: Address your letter with dear+ first name: Dear Carriebegin your letter with a friendly opening phrase: How are you ? It was great to hear from youuse contractions: I’d, I’ve, he’suse phrasal verbs and idiomatic language: sort out, check out, to have a lot on your plateuse exclamation marksend you letter with a friendly closing phrase: Have a great holiday ! hope to see you soon.sign-off very casually+ letter writer’s first name : Lots of love, AriHere are some sample questions of a Formal letter: 1.  2.  3.  Tips to write a formal letter: the letter is addressed Dear sir or Madamimmediately state the purpose: I am writing to complainuse passive voice: was being shown/ should be shownuse formal linking verbs: moreover, furthermoreuse nouns instead or verbs: a great deal of violenceuse fixed phrases: I look forward to your responsesign-off formally: Yours faithfully, DaveI hope this answer was helpful :)
